subject: Law
title: What Qualifies as a Trade Secret?
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Qualifies as a Trade Secret?.

hook.text: The Coca-Cola formula has been secret for over 130 years. No patent, no registrationâ€”just secrecy.

buildup.text: A trade secret is information that derives economic value from not being generally known and is kept secret.

discovery.text: It can be a formula, process, customer list, algorithm, or any business info that gives a competitive edge.

twist.text: Unlike patents, trade secrets last foreverâ€”but only as long as secrecy is maintained. One leak and it's gone.

climax.text: The owner must take reasonable steps to protect the secret: NDAs, restricted access, and security measures.

punchline.text: A trade secret's power is its secrecy. Reveal it and the protection vanishes.

quiz.question: How long does trade secret protection last?
options: Life of the creator plus 70 years
As long as the secret is maintained
